caseStudies.title: Google's business case studies

links.title: The Core Business Model: Advertising üí∞
links.description: This case study explains how Google's primary revenue source is its advertising business model. It details how Google connects businesses with consumers through its search engine, YouTube, and other platforms. The study emphasizes the power of Google Ads and how the company's auction-based pricing model allows it to dominate the digital advertising market, generating a significant majority of its parent company Alphabet's revenue.

links.title: Google Cloud's Enterprise Success ‚òÅÔ∏è
links.description: This page features a collection of customer stories showing how businesses use Google Cloud to solve complex problems. For instance, you can find case studies on how companies like The Super-Pharm pharmacy chain used Vertex AI to improve inventory accuracy by up to 90%, and how HCA Healthcare used generative AI to redesign patient care. These examples highlight Google's growing influence in the enterprise market and its focus on AI and data analytics.

links.title: Community Case Study
links.description: An additional community-provided case study on Google.

caseStudies.description: How publishers use Google's advertising platforms to monetize content and optimize ad revenue.
